website_summaries.verdict: Although not quite as strong as some competitors, the Bowers & Wilkins PX still ranks among the top wireless noise-canceling headphones available right now.
pros: The Bowers & Wilkins PX headphone offers impressive build quality and excellent sound
Wireless operation is nearly flawless, battery life is very good, and a premium carrying case is included
Works well as a headset for making calls
cons: Competing models from Bose, Sony and Beats are less expensive, more comfortable and offer better noise cancelling
-- and its noise cancelling is quite on par with those same competitors

customer_reviews.title: Will not connect
customer_reviews.text: Be careful about buying these through Amazon. Their return window is for 30 days, however my headphones are at less than 50 days old and will not connect to my MacBook (or the other computers I've troubleshooted with). I'm stuck trying to work with the manufacturer to get these replaced or repaired, rather than a simple return on a defective device.
customer_reviews.author: Warren

customer_reviews.title: Defective after 2 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: I liked how these looked, stylish and different from most wireless headphones everyone wears these days. They were comfortable to wear as well. The only downside is they did not last very long functionality wise. I was listening to music with them at work when they just stopped playing any sounds. The power switch became unresponsive, and only the pause/play button worked. Firmware was up to date, tried turning them off and on again, hard resets. Nothing worked. Ordered a replacement, which I hope last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best sound ever
customer_reviews.text: If you want to listen to music, these are by far the best wireless headsets out there period!!! They are very comfortable to wear and they don't make your ears sweat. Noise canceling is OK, not great. Bluetooth range is terrible, probably the worst headset out there when it comes to range. But this one is getting 5 stars because the sound is out of this world. You can listen to music in low volume and still hear everything.
customer_reviews.author: carguy1976

customer_reviews.title: I'm a guy with above average ear size and fit the cup just fine, but my eartips did need to be crunched ...
customer_reviews.text: For headphones at this price I was expecting a more premium sound. There is a definite 'tinny' sound with unclear high's. I wanted to see first hand the things mentioned on other reviews regarding tight fitment. I could sit these on my head for about 2 hours before my jaw and the top of my head began to ache. I'm a guy with above average ear size and fit the cup just fine, but my eartips did need to be crunched a little to fit. I really like the appearance, the USB-C connection, and premium durability. However, the other drawbacks makes this set fall short of what I'm hunting for.
customer_reviews.author: Flip

customer_reviews.title: Superb sound and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1- I have other over-the-ear bluetooth headphones, and these are the best in terms of sound, across the bass to treble spectrum. The soundstage is superb. 2- Comfortable 3- Excellent battery life 4- Good noise reduction Cons: 1- This is probably a bug in Android 10 on the Pixel 3a, but I was unable to pair the headphones with bluetooth on my phone. I wrote B&W about this. Consider these headphones before you buy any other over-the-ear bluetooth headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Hannamaker

customer_reviews.title: Broke within days
customer_reviews.text: The middle button started to fail within a month after regular usage and then the sensors started to go as well. A $400 pair of headphones shouldn't have any issues within the first year and these have had major issues within a month. Very unsatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra F.

customer_reviews.title: Little BASS!!
customer_reviews.text: For $500. Dollers,I thought THESE HEADPHONES MUST SOUND GREAT!!!. They had very little BASS. I AM GONA ORDER THE SONY 1000??,FOR $359.THEY SOUND MUCH BETTER.OH MY SENNHEISER 150'. SOUNDS MUCH BETTER W/ GREAT BASS.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Poor durability for the price
customer_reviews.text: Durability/quality issue, especially for the price. Play button broke within 6 months, with very infrequent use. Since the play button is also the pause button, this can cause unexpected pausing of songs. Now, software for automatically stopping when headphones are removed is badly malfunctioning. Buying some other brand..
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: Best Sound Quality Ever
customer_reviews.text: Best sound quality that I could expect. The headphones are representative of the sound quality that you would receive from B&W speakers. I can hear every aspect of the sound through the headphones. I have had other headphones that emphasis bass but, don't reveal the overall sound. The sound is very balanced and allows me to enjoy sounds of the music.
customer_reviews.author: codemd

customer_reviews.title: No regrets with these headphones
customer_reviews.text: I wear these for several hours per day at the office and around the house on weekends - they block out the surrounding distractions nicely and I've never had to enable the noise cancellation feature. Sound is very nice (I use them both wired to computer and wireless to phone (which has aptx-hd bluetooth capabilities). They took a bit to break in, comfort-wise, but I've had no issues after the first few days - I wear glasses with flexible frames so they've never posed a problem. I've purchase a lot of disappointing headphones over the years - these are a welcome exception.
customer_reviews.author: CraigA

customer_reviews.title: Best budget audiophile wireless headphones! Buy Used!
customer_reviews.text: Sound - 9/10 (treble is a tinch high) (much better than Beyerdynamic Amiron Wireless) Soundstage - Best I have heard in wireless closed-back headphones for $125. Battery life - ~30hrs without Noice cancelling. 22hrs with Noice cancelling. Bonus - Headphones turn sound off if any of the ears are lifted off of your ears. Were expensive at $400+ when launched, but used prices of $125 make this completely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Ankit Goyal

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and comfort
customer_reviews.text: It masks out most ambient noises even without turning on one of the active cancelling modes. Just don't expect it to hold on to your head well during brisk activity; it doesn't clamp on very tight. Perfect for airplanes and the office, or for listening to stuff in bed without disturbing your mate. The blue/gold color combination is sophisticated-looking too.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Shiflet

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality and looks so stylist on my head
customer_reviews.text: I love it. My most expensive headphone. (Before that I used cheaper Sony & Sennheiser). I was a bit skeptical about sound quality but it really amazed me even without “break in” hours. And it keep performing better. Also I love how awesome the look is. I got compliments for wearing it in coffee shops. Overall I’m very happy about my purchase after 5 months using it. Now i’m a fan of B&W
customer_reviews.author: Lam Tran

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality is top notch!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a pair of P5 in the past and switched brands as I was not happy with the proprietary audio cable and the fact that they broke twice. After using Parrot Zik 2.0's for five plus years and the workmanship is lackluster at best and are falling apart I decided to switch back to B&W with the PX model. I cannot believe the difference, the sound quality is incredible along with the product quality, this is a very refined and solid product.
customer_reviews.author: C. T. Hulbert

customer_reviews.title: I love these headphones
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones. Comfortable. The sound separation and sound stage are remarkable. Songs that've listened to for years take on a new, deeper quality. The bass is balanced and not overly powerful. Sounds better with NC off, but not bad with NC on. NC is as good as the Bose QC, which is the benchmark. The batter life is amazing! 25-30h with consistent use. It is quite comfortable. It is very nice looking as well. I do love the automatic pause feature, although occasionally it gets buggy where I have adjust the sensitivity with the phone app.
customer_reviews.author: Ein

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even last an year. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: When I first received the product, they felt like a decent pair of headphones. But over time, they started to get uncomfortable, the cushioning got worse after 2 months. Light usage - about 10-15 hrs a week for watching movies primarily. Didn't use them for workouts. Finally they gave up after 10 months. They don't pair with other devices. Even if they do they don't play any sound. On top of that, it does this infuriating screech randomly. Extremely disappointed after spending 300 bucks on this pair. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Anudeep

customer_reviews.title: Great head phones
customer_reviews.text: I used Bose noise cancellation head phones for years, PW have a 1st class in sound. They did not work at first needed to down load application on my computer, than start to work on my kindle Fire, has no airline apter, unlike the Bose. There is no customer support phone number.
customer_reviews.author: Starr

customer_reviews.title: Superior build and sound quality over competitors
customer_reviews.text: People are correct, the noise cancelling is not as good as the Bose or the Sony, but they are SO much superior in sound quality and materials. This is real leather, real aluminum, quality cables etc. I have worn them for hours on a plane, and have not experienced any discomfort on my ears or my head. Oh, and did I mention that the sound quality is SUPERIOR to the Bose and the Sony, both of which I currently own also?
customer_reviews.author: PhilD

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: My ENT doctor told me to stop using my very nice ear buds or I would be repeating the very painful removal of impacted ear wax. After some research, I bought these. Wow, what a difference! Especially the bass. It is my habit to listen to classical music and opera to fall asleep at night. With these I have to try to fall asleep on my back, but the full, clear sound from my iPhone library is wonderful. Contrary to some reviews, I find them quite comfortable. That they shut off when you take them off, and resume where you left off when you put them back on, is very practical.
customer_reviews.author: Cyril C. Penn

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Sound, Decent NC
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality from these, especially considering the source material is usually from a streaming service, is top notch. Deep rich bass, nice mids, and crisp highs. Turning on noise cancellation does "flatten" the sound somewhat, but it's still leaps and bounds better than most headphones I've tried. Battery life lasts at least 12 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Puleo

customer_reviews.title: Very Sensitive, automatic on off was BAD.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these and was so impressed with the sound quality and noise canceling, I loved them! Then I found if I moved head wrong or did not put them on right with my glasses they would lose signal... they were either shorting out or they were so sensitive that they shut off all the time. I tried all sorts of stuff to make them work, like a different pair of glasses, snugging them down on ears, but they continually lost signal and shut off. I sent them back. I would say the automatic on and off was not working properly, but the sound was awesome as was the noise cancelling.
customer_reviews.author: Jean I. Loyning

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality
customer_reviews.text: Great build quality, great sound, look great and perform even better. Bluetooth connectivity works well, wish I could get a bit more range. Seems about 40 ft. is the max. Noise cancellation works very well. Good bass and nice clean sound. Definite upgrade over the P3. Would have been happier if I could have found them on sale somewhere. Wireless charging would make these a 5. Can get a bit uncomfortable with prolonged use. Nice clothe carrying pouch. Nylon braided cables would have been a nice touch. But, the sound is top notch and should get better with burn in.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Better than Sony WH1000XM3
customer_reviews.text: A very good pair of $300 headphones. Sound quality is overall solid, and the earcups, despite feeling like they clamp hard, end up being comfortable for long stretches of time. The active noise cancellation is only moderately strong - much of the noise cancellation is passive. Buttons are not labeled, but they are intuitively laid out, I only had to look at the manual once. The auto-pause-when-you-remove-your-headphones feature is nifty and works pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: CL

customer_reviews.title: Great sound (ANC off), heavy, not for people who wear glasses.
customer_reviews.text: Bottom line: - Amazing Full round sound when ANC is off. - Heavy on the head and very tight on the ears. - Not suitable for people with glasses. - ANC is good for ambient sound but not for street and people chatter, for this go for the B&O 8i or 9i. They are the only brand that releases a second version for ANC. - Lighter, smaller but still sound amazing are the AKG NC60. - App takes too long to load so I rarely use it. - Very good volume and good base.
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: These don’t work at all. I bought them off treasure truck for my flights. Shame on me for not checking the “No returns” policy. The cord, when plugged in to the airplane jack, doesn’t connect or produce sound. The headphones require an app be installed on you phone to work via Bluetooth, but loses connectivity constantly. It may be I got a defective pair, but nevertheless I spend a fortune for headphones that work about as well as $3 truck stop headphones. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Ramona Stewart

customer_reviews.title: The quality those cans are built is amazing. They really got gorgeous look
customer_reviews.text: The quality those cans are built is amazing. They really got gorgeous look. Sound is fantastic with all kinds of music. Those built in futures are also very helpful. They are pricy but you know what you paying for. Like with every gadget we gonna find some hard critics, so just go try them on and decide for you self, believe me you won’t be disappointed. RW
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Sound is good after break in period. Noise cancellation not on par with competitors. All basic but buggy, specifically with respect to battery life indication. Biggest reason to avoid is poor service. Battery started acting up erratically, contacted B/W support and was provided with no option for battery replacement, an upgrade path to the newer PX kit for an exuberant price. $399 paperweight at this point. Much better options out there. Avoid and do yourself a favor.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Requires a factory reset to sync again
customer_reviews.text: This has terrible support for PCs (Mac and Windows). Because it attempts to hold sync info for multiple devices, it can't sync to Windows unless you factory reset first. It's very confusing to see it show up in the PC's bluetooth menu but not as an audio device. I have no interest in ever using this with a phone, but I have to connect it to my phone to configure it. And that is lost every time I have to sync.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Breaks the bluetooth sound quality barrier!
customer_reviews.text: Best sounding bluetooth headphones I've ever used. Prettiest headphones I've ever used. Build quality that rivals the likes of some high end Ultrasones. These are the headphones of the future! I don't even have to turn them on and off; just make sure your dac/phone is on and put them on your head and it does the rest from where you left off. Passive sound isolation is sufficient that I don't need the active one (it hurts the sound quality anyway). These headphones truly have a sound quality that I never thought bluetooth could achieve. They are definitely fun cans, so keep that in mind. Well worth the price of admission, probably more tbh!
customer_reviews.author: S-06

customer_reviews.title: Pretty awesome
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are pretty awesome. I have big ears and my ears FIT INSIDE ! its is great. however, there is only one way to wear them due to the inside being slanted. I love the color of them. I know there are updated version but they arent as good looking as these ones. I use these for gaming personally as well as studying. I would recommend getting them. I only have to charge them once every few days while wearing them around 8 hours a day.
customer_reviews.author: Deepshadows69

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic all around, amazing sound, second to none build, Just make sure to upgrade the firmware!!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound and makes airplanes so much more comfortable/less stressful. great battery life, honestly I haven't been able to drain them completely before charging. Audio quality is fantastic! and after Firmware updates, the auto-pause and ANC works flawlessly. Get these over the sony mx1000x2 the build quality is better, the ANC is equal and the ear cups are more comfortable. Firmware is easy to upgrade through the B&W app Side note if you have a 2016 and newer MacBook Pro or a late model android phone you can use its USB-c charger to charge these so fewer cables to travel with
customer_reviews.author: ajh

customer_reviews.title: Bad product, no customer service
customer_reviews.text: They only worked for about ten hours of use. Won’t charge and you can’t connect when plugged in. Customer service isn’t accessible. Their online customer service site won’t let you submit inquiries. Bad experience all around
customer_reviews.author: Michael K Parks

customer_reviews.title: Love the PX’s for day at work
customer_reviews.text: Love the PX’s for day at work. Exactly what I needed and although not the quietest of ANC headphones out there. They are sufficient for office and comfortable with great quality. I was debating on returning them if not worth the money but couldn’t for the great price of $300. They are very enjoyable to own.
customer_reviews.author: M. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy just run...junk
customer_reviews.text: When they work they are great but less than 6 months in they don’t even turn on. Turns out they are junk.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great earphones with superb sound and details
customer_reviews.text: Great earphones with superb sound and details, but since that's not the only criteria for a good product, these things prevent this awesome product from getting a 5-stars rating (yes, I knew about the first one before purchasing): 1. No option for a passive mode - Everything is going through the DAC, plus you need battery. 2. Really big, and don't really fold. 3. Power management/turning on/off is really annoying to performs manually, but sometimes using the automatic control is problematic (when connected to a mac, every time you restart playing, it causes itunes to launch.
customer_reviews.author: DonnerJack

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound and Build Quality but Uncomfortable to Wear
customer_reviews.text: I decided on the PX's due to better sound and build quality than the Bose and Sony equivalent headphones. Unfortunately I had to return them since they clamped too hard around my ears and the head band put too much pressure on the top of my head. I was also having connection issues with my Pixel 3XL using Pandora. These headphones offer great sound and build quality but just aren't comfortable to wear. I hope B&W improves this issue on their just announced PX7's.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous sound!!
customer_reviews.text: These sound amazing!! I would not say that the NC is as good as the Bose but the audio quality with NC off is amazing! The best I have heard to date. Be sure to set your MacBook to use aptx, just google that. Skype calls are great as well, I had to return the Senn 550s due to an issue with Mac/Skype but these are rock solid.
customer_reviews.author: Pete826

customer_reviews.title: No EQ control? Am I missing something?
customer_reviews.text: An audaphile review; Pros; - build quality, design - better sound stage for a headphone (don’t expect a sound stage anywhere near to an actual hifi stereo system) - compact Cons; - Bloated mids (I don’t like it, I listen mostly jazz and it did not go well with my taste) - No EQ control (dealbreaker for me)
customer_reviews.author: Mike Behar

customer_reviews.title: Elegant design, Wonderful sound, adequate ANC
customer_reviews.text: Bought these refurbished or open item. Either way they were like new. Simple straightforward headsets. Love the auto pause function. Especially around the office. They found great. The Bose were to bright in sound and the sonys were muddy comparatively. Materials are great and elegant. Noise cancelling was good enough for the airplane. Don't travel too much so my priority wasn't on the ANC function. Sound took higher priority. Highly recommend if you want better sound and want to stand apart from the plasticky cans out in the wild. If you don't care for sound and want more focus on the ANC I recommend the other two mainstream headsets.
customer_reviews.author: jose ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Warranty Service Impossible To Obtain
customer_reviews.text: Product stopped pairing after 4 months. I have 2 bluetooth transmitters and another wireless headset. These products pair just fine. Bowers and Wilkins no longer pair. To obtain warranty service you must go through an extremely convoluted website to get a link to apply online for a Warranty Authorization. After finishing the application their server does not upload the application. I am sure this review will upload just fine. Will never buy another Bowers & Wilkins product.
customer_reviews.author: tommattson

customer_reviews.title: better than any other noise cancelling headphones (tried all the ...
customer_reviews.text: Stellar sound, better than any other noise cancelling headphones (tried all the big names, eight overall). Only knock is the dull bass with some classical music, but the wide sound stage, clarity and overall detail make up for it. Good noise cancelling. Not on the same level as Sony & Bose, but better than Sennheiser HD1 & B&O H9. I will take better sound over reduced NC any day.
customer_reviews.author: CClay

customer_reviews.title: Amazing !!!
customer_reviews.text: What's not to like? I love B&W products in general, and these do not disappoint :) I have LG v30 phone with Quad DAC and AptX HD, which is a match made in heaven. Why there is only one phone on the market that tries to please audiophiles? Price of course is very difficult to swallow...
customer_reviews.author: enemyofthesame

customer_reviews.title: The best you can get
customer_reviews.text: These are the BEST when used with the iPhone app. They cut background noise to almost zero (you choose one of three levels). I ride the train and will never have to listen to another stupid nearby conversation again. After 24 hours of use the music gets even clearer and more full. They are a peaceful island in a chaotic world. Ahhhhhh...
customer_reviews.author: John P.

customer_reviews.title: Constant Static, Poor sound quality, and a Seller who refused to refund.
customer_reviews.text: Product was a gift and because of COVID reached it recipient late. By the time they tried them it was past the return policy, but the headphones are horrible. They produce a constant static sound, they are very tight on the ears, even after stretching them, the provided charging cable is very short. All around a bad product, when I reached out to the seller to address the issue, the only response I got was "They were worn, we cannot return them". Would not recommend. The battery never really got tested, as they were not used much at all.
customer_reviews.author: James H

customer_reviews.title: Bought them for the sound quality and they are great - the best recommendation is when you start listening ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought them for the sound quality and they are great - the best recommendation is when you start listening to your back catalogue and hear it all afresh. Not put the noise cancellation into test yet but over ear design cuts out normal background noise well. Really comfortable which is an important parameter many headphones fail. Automatic detection works well, connecting to new Bluetooth devices took a few attempts to discover which button to hold, just a bit fiddly at first until you know what to do but then works well.
customer_reviews.author: Darcy

customer_reviews.title: requires work but worth the trouble
customer_reviews.text: first you have to find the right angle for your head, if you wear glasses (like i do) it varies a lot, is not just put and play like qc35 for example. then you have to wait for the leather to adapt to your head/glasses, you can speed up the process with a bit of ingenuity. they require a little burning for optimal sound. Is all this hassle worth it? absolutely, the sound quality is wayy ahead of qc35/px550 which i own.
customer_reviews.author: Andres Mercado

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic headphones. I was worried about spending this much, but I researched like crazy and in the end, these headphones were the only ones with everything I wanted. So glad I got them! The sound quality is excellent, they're comfortable, the battery life is great, and the USB-C is incredible for charging and listening at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Trewartha

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound. Surprised!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound. Surprised! Connected to iPhone, iPad, Apple TV, MBP no problem. Wear sensor does not work too well when wearing over a baseball cap
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't pair
customer_reviews.text: I spent an hour trying to pair the B&W PX with my iPhone X and iPad Pro. No luck, so returned.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Superb wireless headphones.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome headphones, excellent noise cancelling when you need it. Beautiful fidelity in the sound, as you would expect from Bowers & Wilkins, great battery life, very comfortable and they look great. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: MrB

customer_reviews.title: Nice build quality
customer_reviews.text: Have used Audio Technica for years. B&W are definitely a cut above. Nice build quality. Noise cancelling very good. Sound quality exceptional. Pairing was s breeze. A little tight to start but they do ease up. Not cheap but worth it. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Howard

customer_reviews.title: Bowers & Wilkins does not disappoint !
customer_reviews.text: Despite seeing a lot of comments about the weight and feel of the headphones, I purchased a pair based on my prior experience with the B & W P7’s. I was not disappointed, their sound and noise cancelling are as good as any of their competitors and as for the weight and feel issue, I just returned from a trip to London and I wore them during the entire flight with no discomfort whatsoever ! Amazing pair of headphones !
customer_reviews.author: Joe M

customer_reviews.title: Wow. Just wow.
customer_reviews.text: Bit finnicky to get setup and the firmware updated, but once it's there the app gives fantastic control over noise cancellation and the sound is just sublime....
customer_reviews.author: Linus

customer_reviews.title: Genuinely surprised and happy
customer_reviews.text: These things actively cancel noise like a pro. Put them on and the world goes silent, it's pretty amazing. Battery life is fantastic, and the noise canceling works well enough that my lawn mower no longer hurts my ears. Sound quality is great, finally get to hear the little intricate bits of songs that you never hear in the car. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Really Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these from the Treasure Truck. Seemed like a good deal, but to be honest my cheap Sony MDRs sound better with more bass and these really didn’t cancel out the noise. When it was cancelling, the sound quality dropped off. But I gave them a chance and after only a few days the switch stopped working and they wouldn’t shut off.
customer_reviews.author: The Chief

customer_reviews.title: Looking for ease of use? Go somewhere else.
customer_reviews.text: A major fail on B&W's part. Extremely difficult set-up instructions. Repeated malfunctions. Sounds great when it's on and working, which is seldom. Looking for something you can pop on your head and listen to hassle-free when you step on the plane? This isn't it. My third set of B&W headphones. The others were traditional and worked great. Not this one, which will be my last.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely amazing. I use these during my daily ~2 hr ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing. I use these during my daily ~2 hr commute, and love every feature. A firmware update has also greatly improved SQ with ANC on. I have no issues with comfort, and I wear glasses. The only thing is that sometimes the glasses cause the seal to be lost just slightly, so it does take a bit of working with. Overall, these are wonderful headphones for the price.
customer_reviews.author: fuse_Man91

customer_reviews.title: A life saver on airline flights.
customer_reviews.text: Great product here. It has a little glitch when trying to connect to more than one Bluetooth device. Top notch noise cancellation, and sound quality. The ear cups are a little small for my ears, I must have a big head. I’m almost 6’4” so the ear cups feel tight after a few hours of nonstop listening on this PX model.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: 5 star sound with 4 star comfort.
customer_reviews.text: I'm no audiophile, but I really enjoyed the sound quality from these cans. Noise cancelling is decent too, but noise isolation was good enough that I didn't need it if I wasn't in the subway. Just couldn't deal with the awkward fit and pads.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: I’d say it takes about 3 days to a week for the drivers to fully break-in.
customer_reviews.text: The app is a must. The ability to adjust the ANC to the environment is crucial, especially in a big city like New York. I like their weight. Though they are on the heavy side. They for great. They sound amazing without ANC but only in the quietest of rooms, beyond that I leave them on ANC “Street” mode. Battery life is great.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Kane

customer_reviews.title: Fell short of my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: These are good headphones. Noise canceling feature works really well. Was very disappointed with the sound quality only in comparison to my B&O H8 and H9i headphones. Really wanted to give a more positive review though. Especially considering the fact that my 9.1 home theater system is comprised of all Bowers & Wilkins speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Love Extreme

customer_reviews.title: Returned it
customer_reviews.text: Build quality is great but that's about it. Returned it. ANC wasn't great and neither were the low ends. It's probably good sound wise for listening to classical music. The special feature which stops music when the headphones are removed malfunctions a lot. The clamping force of the headset is a lot making it unusable for longer durations. It's also pretty expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Ritchie

customer_reviews.title: No word to describe this item, only two word ...
customer_reviews.text: No word to describe this item, only two word unrealistic sounds, for the price. Bowers & Wilkins nothing gets closer.
customer_reviews.author: Emilio J Gutiérrez

customer_reviews.title: If looking for noise-cancellation, look elsewhere!!!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the style of these headphones and they are fairly comfortable. The sound is excellent as is the battery life. That said, I found the noise cancellation to be lacking, especially for a headphones in this price category, so I returned them. My recommendation would be to spend a bit more for the Bose, Sony, or B&O.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Towey

customer_reviews.title: ***Outstanding-highly recommend ***
customer_reviews.text: Love these headphones! Quality throughout. I also own bang & olufsen h9i and Sony wh-1000xm2. These are a much better fit and actually sound better even though I’m still in the “run in” period. The comfort is amazing and the iOS app is well designed, useful and intuitive. Buy these if you are on the fence in your comparison between b&o and Sony. You won’t regret this procurement.
customer_reviews.author: OBXer4LIFE

customer_reviews.title: Pain in the butt to connect multiple devices
customer_reviews.text: It's a pain to connect to the phone,pc, and tablet. You have to download the app to get them to connect. Couldn't even get them working on my pc and tablet. It's like these headphones were developed only for one phone. Audio quality is 3.5/5 though. Needs more bass.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If only they had better ear pads
customer_reviews.text: Originally I was impressed however the ear pads are so uncomfortable that I can’t wear for even thirty minutes. Contacted the manufacturer for support and was told most people like them. That was what they call customer support.
customer_reviews.author: Sweet Willie

customer_reviews.title: Tremendous headphones
customer_reviews.text: I have been a long time fan of B&W and was excited when these we released. I intially had a pair of the Bose qc35 but was not impressed by the build quality or the sound. The B&W's so far have been far superior to the Bose. The sound stage is more open, with punchier bass and beautiful mids. The build quality are astonishing, they feel and look great. The noise cancelling works very well, I have used both the airplane and office setting invivo and can attest they work well. Overall, likely the best set of noise cancelling headphones in the category.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kay

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding cans!
customer_reviews.text: These cans sound great, including bluetooth aptxHD. The sound is well-balanced with good bass and good clarity. They are not quite as comfortable as my other headphones, which may be due to their weight and headband construction. Battery life is stellar.
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones with terrible experience
customer_reviews.text: Incredible headphones! Love them! However, they are not working correctly for me. I'm listening to music and all the sudden ticking noise and audio stops playing. It has the latest firmware and is fully charged. I'm having same issues on Android and iOS devices. It's very frustrating to have to turn it off and on again to get it to work. Some cases after few minutes the issue comes back. I'm looking to get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: J. Meson

customer_reviews.title: Oustanding sound, but uncomfortable on your head
customer_reviews.text: They have oustanding sound (best I've heard on earphones), great battery life, nice features (auto play/stop and standby by gestures), quality construction, BT, aux and USB playback, now they come with a great case (no need to buy one), but they are uncomfortable on your ears. I don't know if they'll start feeling better with time, but right now, you feel the pressure on your head (1 month of not too often use)
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo

customer_reviews.title: B&W ANC: Awful, Not clear
customer_reviews.text: I expected so much from B&W, based on previous experiences with their products. Unfortunately, these missed the mark by a long shot. The bass was not deep. The highs were not crystal. The mids were not balanced. Overall the sound was not clean.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: 5 months old and won't hold a charge
customer_reviews.text: Love these headphones. The sound and noise cancelling is amazing. VERY disappointed that at 5 months old they will not hold a charge anymore. At this price point they should last for years, not months.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but not nice enough for me.
customer_reviews.text: Heavy headphones and the sound just wasn't what I was looking for--it just wasn't "expansive like the B&O beoplay headphones; although the noise cancelling feature is better than the B&Os, so there's that to consider; however, the sound quality in noise cancelling mode isn't as good as the B&O Beoplays, so that's an issue too.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew J. Harding

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$$$
customer_reviews.text: Best pair of over the ears I've ever had. Rare blend of crisp sound separation and deep base range. Bluetooth features work great with my Android phone. Buy these!
customer_reviews.author: Jon A.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy if you wear glasses!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones have too much side pressure and the ear cups are too stiff. If you wear glasses, they will crush them against your head. I thought they might break in over time but after a month they still haven’t. I think they may have even bent my glasses!
customer_reviews.author: Finch

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: The headphones are a little uncomfortable at first and I will say it's probably a little better if you don't wear glasses. I did notice while on a bus ride that the noise cancellation is almost unnecessary with most outside noise going on around as long as the ear cups seal to your head. The bluetooth connection is nice and the functionality of the pause and sleep mode are great, but the headphones sound about 100 times better when plugged in with a cable to your phone or whatever you're using. I think the bluetooth setting might be more effective for convenience but if you want really high quality audio use the cord that comes with them.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Very good sound quality and ANC, bad comfort
customer_reviews.text: Its sound quailty is really good and ANC definitely does its job. Material quailty is probably one of the best in that price tag. It covers all my big ears and it is comfortable for 1-1.5 hours maybe. Its clamping force is way too much, which is nice and bad at the same time. It is nice because those are super stable on the head. But it gets uncomfortable after some time and this is my only concern with them.
customer_reviews.author: GYiyen

customer_reviews.title: Average ANC capability, not worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected. For the price I assumed the noise cancelling and sound isolation would be better. I have a pair of Taotronic ANC headphones which are comparable to these for a 5th of the price.... Don't get me wrong, fit & finish is far superior; that's not worth the price though.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Not an all day wear headphone
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality, build quality, and battery are all great. The fit is the only thing that could use some improvement. If you are someone that wants a pair of headphones to wear all day I would advise you to look into something a bit lighter. For me its not a deal breaker because I don't plan on using it for more than 2-3hr at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Dwaine

customer_reviews.title: Most uncomfortable best sounded headphones
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sound amazing, compared to other wireless headphones, but the break-in period for the foam that cups your ears is a lie. It's been almost 2 months and I've been wearing them hoping they'll break in soon, but they're still as uncomfortable as the day I bought them. If sound quality is your thing, get these, but if you want something comfortable, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Elvis Dao

customer_reviews.title: Superior sound great headphones
customer_reviews.text: Best headphones on the market. I had the Bose wireless noise cancelling headphones (Q35) and a friend recommended that I get these. I am glad I did. I did a comparison between the two and the B&W had superior sound. When listening to music you can pick up the sound from every instrument. It’s amazing. Crisp, clear - the base is greAt. They pair with my iPhone effortlessly and the battery lasts forever it seems!
customer_reviews.author: shoff

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely blissful
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these! I was on a plane filled with crying babies. Put on the headphones with soft music playing and was able to sleep for the whole trip. It was a wonderful flight.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones, especially when they are on sale!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best noise canceling headphones on the market. The sound quality is outstanding. Noise canceling is great. They are a bit more heavy than the competition, but the sound quality is superior.
customer_reviews.author: J. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: If this is a beauty pageant then PX wins
customer_reviews.text: These Headphones looks stunning and have good sound quality but uncomfortable for long hours. As previous reviewers mentioned these have heavy clamping force. If you happen to have large ears these will cause pain. Comfort aside these are good pair of headphones having latest features with an exception of passive audio. Didn’t understand why B&W didn’t allow passive audio for these cans may be shifting the trend towards USB-C audio. I would recommend these if they are on sale around ~$200
customer_reviews.author: Amith R

customer_reviews.title: Solid headphones while they worked
customer_reviews.text: After using these, strickly at my desk at work, for 4 months sound stoped working. These have never been mistreated and remained in my locked desk when not in use. Power on, but don’t play. Loved the sound quality with NC off while I had the ability to enjoy them. Go with the P7 or p9’s and you’ll be better off.
customer_reviews.author: kevin nickel

customer_reviews.title: Great sounding headphones.  Not comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: I used these headphones for about 2 weeks but decided to return them. The reason? They were not very comfortable on my head. I have a large head and large ears and the clamping force was just too much pressure. I can’t justify $400 for headphones that aren’t comfortable. Everything else about these headphones are fantastic. Build quality is superb. Design is beautiful and the sound is great.
customer_reviews.author: Br

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth doesn’t work after 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones. I have owned lots of headphones over the years and these are by far the best. However, I gave them one star because the Bluetooth doesn’t work anymore. I received these on December 12th and it’s now December 29th and they don’t work. They work with an auxiliary cord, but my iPhone 11 Pro doesn’t have an auxiliary jack. I’m on my first flight to Italy and have no Bluetooth. I’m very disappointed that this has occurred. This never even happened to my cheap Bluetooth headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Jon F.

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Exceptional sound and extremely easy to operate. I'm really impatient with cludgy tech, and this just functions effortlessly. Background noises at work or on airplanes are well dampened. Feels solid, but not heavy.
customer_reviews.author: GH

customer_reviews.title: I was sad to return them because they were really cool
customer_reviews.text: They work very well (minus a slight buzzing every now and then) and look very sleek and downright stylish. However, they wouldn't charge (and I tried several chords/outlets/devices so I returned them. Everything was reimbursed and processed efficiently. I was sad to return them because they were really cool!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice headphones
customer_reviews.text: Very nice headphones, well bilt and sounds great, sometimes a little tight on the head and looks like the battery was dropping and a little faster than expected but manageable.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Despite the fact that these are more expensive than the average headphones they are worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence W. Lipman

customer_reviews.title: You take a chance buying used.
customer_reviews.text: They looked nice coming out of the box but then when I tried them they sounded terrible. There is obviously a crack in the speaker. It is very noticeable when you hear any bass. I will never buy used again.
customer_reviews.author: Guitars rcool

customer_reviews.title: great sound and fit
customer_reviews.text: Wow, great sound and fit. The automatic on/off when putting on/taking off works great. I didn't know what I was missing until I bought these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D.

customer_reviews.title: material, sound, and customer service Going The Extra Mile
customer_reviews.text: I've had these headphones for almost a year. Battery life is just as good as when I bought them and the sound is too. Great product, worth the money. And great customer service to top it off! (The same sound system in some Maseratis, Mclearns, and Volvos)
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Good but too heavy
customer_reviews.text: It is the best Bluetooth earphone I have owned, but it is also the heaviest earphone! The sounds are amazing, I really like it. But I can't wear it for a long time, my head is crashing by it. And I can't wear it when I walk.
customer_reviews.author: Wiz

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful B&W sound & noise cancellation
customer_reviews.text: Great typical B&W speaker sounds w/good bass! Takes a while to pair w/all devices but it may be the Marantz receiver as it was less an issue w/others. USB-C a connection is a great feature.
customer_reviews.author: Amz user reviewing

customer_reviews.title: but once you do they are extremely comfortable. Not to mention the style is astonishing
customer_reviews.text: Takes a little bit of use to wear these in, but once you do they are extremely comfortable. Not to mention the style is astonishing.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Traylor

customer_reviews.title: Meets and Exceeds Expectations
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are just the right size, fit over the ear comfortably, not too bulky, have intuitive controls, and sound fantastic! Most satisfying headphones I've had the pleasure to put listen to. They are well made and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: M. Huisenga

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of BT headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of BT headphones. Comfortable and stylish. Sound signature is very nuetral, not bass heavy at all. ANC is ok as is the App. Does lag behind the Sony WH 1000's in NC and App functionality. But still a very good pair of headphones
customer_reviews.author: BK

product_meta.title: Bowers & Wilkins PX Active Noise Cancelling Wireless Headphones Best-in-class Sound, Space Grey
product_meta.description: Color:BlackSupported Bluetooth Codecs:aptx-HD , AAC , SBC Supported Bluetooth Profiles : A2DP v1.3 , AVRCP v1.6 , HFP v1.6 , HSP v1.2 , GAP , SDAP , DIP
feature_bullets: Bowers & Wilkins PERFORMANCE - PX draws on decades of Bowers & Wilkins design experience to take you to the very heart of the music with its breath-taking performance

ADAPTIVE NOISE CANCELLATION - Perfect sound anywhere - on a plane, in the street or in the office. The best adaptive noise cancelling headphones, customizable to your exact preference. Battery life- Up to 22 hours BT/ANC. Up to 29 hours BT/no ANC. Up to 33 hours ANC/wired. Up to 50 hours wired/no ANC

FEEL MORE OF YOUR MUSIC - Built with the same drive units from our P9 Signature headphones, the PX provides optimized listening performance. We have also subtly angled the drivers to provide a more natural stereo perspective. Impedance: 22 ohms (passive)
PX RESPONDS TO YOU - When you need to pause, lift an ear cup. Put PX down and it goes to sleep. Pick it up to resume playing. Worry less about your headphones and enjoy your music more.

SMART POWER - With a 22-hour battery life, PX is always ready; put it down and it goes into power-saving sleep mode; pick it up and you're good to go. PX is the smartest Bluetooth headphone on the market.
TO GET THE BEST FROM PX, install the latest version of the firmware. This is done via the dedicated Bowers & Wilkins Headphones app, downloadable for free from the AppStore or Google Play Store.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars1,645 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
